clinical_study.brief_title: Acute and Chronic Inflammatory Disease, Lifestyle and Treatment Response
clinical_study.official_title: Impact of Lifestyle and Treatment on the Recurrency and Severity of Acute and Chronic Inflamatory Eye Diseases: Protocol on Prospective Cohort Study

collaborator.agency: Wrocław University of Science and Technology

brief_summary.textblock:
Acute and chronic inflammatory eye diseases are difficult to diagnose and maintain quiescent with therapy. Proposed study is aimed to find on the one hand, novel factors for recurrence of the disease or remission of inflammation and evaluation of the impact of lifestyle and known factors on the other.
Each patient is treated in accordance to the best of medical knowledge and guidelines for each disease.
This prospective cohort study will enroll uveitic patients to the steroid only group (SG), combined (steroid and adjuvant drug) group (CG) or bilogic therapy group (BTG).
At baseline, patient data are recorded using patient-reported outcome measures and clinical assessments (ophthalomology) on disease activity (clinical scales), quality of life, and lifestyle together with registry data on comorbidity and medication. During follow-up evaluation of a successful treatment outcome response will be based on clinical scales and most frequently used primary endpoints; the major outcome of the analyses will be to detect differences in treatment outcome between patients in different treatment group.

primary_outcome.description: Total number of treatment success in each group
Time to the next recurrence after the treatment regimen introduction
Time and cause of severe visual loss

secondary_outcome.description: Visual Acuity will be performed with ETDRS charts different for right and left eye

secondary_outcome.measure: The SUN working group grading system for anterior chamber cells
secondary_outcome.description: At each visit anterior chamber will be examined to assess anterior chamber cells (1mm x 1mm slit beam in height and width, when thrown at an angle of 45-60°). The recorded number of cells will be used to determine the grade according to the SUN criteria.

secondary_outcome.measure: The SUN working group grading system for anterior chamber flare
secondary_outcome.description: At each visit anterior chamber will be examined to assess anterior chamber flare (1mm x 1mm slit beam in height and width, when thrown at an angle of 45-60°). The observed changes will be used to determine the grade according to the SUN criteria.

secondary_outcome.measure: AREDS 2008 Clinical Lens Opacity Grading Procedure
secondary_outcome.description: Using AREDS system for classifying cataracts from photographs: AREDS Report No. 4 the lens opacity will be graded.

secondary_outcome.measure: NIH grading system for vitreous cells
secondary_outcome.description: At each visit vitreous will be examined to assess vitreous cells (1mm x 3mm slit beam in anterior vitreous). The recorded number of cells will be used to determine the grade according to the NIH criteria.

secondary_outcome.measure: NIH grading system for vitreous haze
secondary_outcome.description: At each visit vitreous will be examined to assess vitreous haze. The recorded of clarity of posterior pole funduscopy will be used to determine the grade according to the NIH criteria.
OCT EDI recordings processed with developed by researchers methodology for image processing.

other_outcome.description: PCR-positive result of COVID-19 specific testing, no treatment required

PCR-positive result of COVID-19 specific testing, patient require treatment. The mode of treatment will be recorded into several groups: 1) antibiotics, 2) antivirals, 3) biologic treatment, 4) immunoglobulins, 5) steroids

other_outcome.measure: COVID-19 related acute respiratory distress syndrome (ARDS)
other_outcome.description: COVID-19 related acute respiratory distress syndrome (ARDS). Situation in which patients need any of described below: 1) supportive oxygen therapy, 2) non-invasive ventilation, 3) invasive/ mechanical ventilation, 4) use of ECMO, 5) admission to intensive care unit, 6) dialysis

intervention.description: Surveillance card and additional examination to find novel markers and better assess the existing ones

study_pop.textblock: Any patient with a new diagnosis or a recurrence of uni or bilateral uveitis.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- new diagnosis of uni or bilateral uveitis
- recurrence of the diagnosed previously uni or bilateral uveitis
Exclusion Criteria:
- not mentally able to reply the questionnaire

patient_data.ipd_description: Sharing coded data such as BCVA, intraocular preassure, visual functioning questionaire responses, anterior chamber cells and flare scales records as well as lens opacity grading records.
